title: Asset Lists
description: Asset lists are a similar mechanism to allow frontends and other UIs to fetch metadata associated with Cosmos SDK denoms, especially for assets sent over IBC.

description.description: [OPTIONAL] A short description of the asset

additional_information.description: [OPTIONAL] A list of up to 10 objects that have key:value pairs. Example {"chain_website": "link"}, this will generally be utilized for front-ends.

pretty_path.description: [OPTIONAL] A single string representing a bridged token.

type_asset.description: [OPTIONAL] The potential options for type of asset. By default, assumes sdk.coin

address.description: [OPTIONAL] The address of the asset. Only required for type_asset : cw20, snip20

base.description: The base unit of the asset. Must be in denom_units.

name.description: The project name of the asset. For example Bitcoin.

display.description: The human friendly unit of the asset. Must be in denom_units.

symbol.description: The symbol of an asset. For example BTC.

traces.description: The origin of the asset, starting with the index, and capturing all transitions in form and location.

ibc.description: [OPTIONAL] IBC Channel between src and dst between chain

coingecko_id.description: [OPTIONAL] The coingecko id to fetch asset data from coingecko v3 api. See https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/coins/list

keywords.description: [OPTIONAL] An array of up to 20 keywords to describe the asset/ecosystem.

asset_pointer.description: The (primary) key used to identify an asset defined within the Chain Registry.

platform.description: The platform from which the asset originates. E.g., 'cosmoshub', 'ethereum', 'forex', or 'nasdaq'

base_denom.description: The base unit of the asset on its source platform. E.g., when describing ATOM from Cosmos Hub, specify 'uatom', NOT 'atom' nor 'ATOM'; base units are unique per platform.

chain_name.description: The name of the counterparty chain. (must match exactly the chain name used in the Chain Registry)

base_denom.description: The base unit of the asset on its source platform. E.g., when describing ATOM from Cosmos Hub, specify 'uatom', NOT 'atom' nor 'ATOM'; base units are unique per platform.

channel_id.description: The counterparty IBC transfer channel(, e.g., 'channel-1').
The chain's IBC transfer channel(, e.g., 'channel-1').

path.description: The port/channel/denom input string that generates the 'ibc/...' denom.

port.description: The port used to transfer IBC assets; often 'transfer', but sometimes varies, e.g., for outgoing cw20 transfers.

chain_name.description: The chain or platform from which the asset originates. E.g., 'cosmoshub', 'ethereum', 'forex', or 'nasdaq'
